channel.title: Err...maybe I should stick to coding. =[
channel.description:
Well, I desided to give modeling a try...I'm no good at it. I was messing around with Metasequoia and with the primitive things I made a shield with a paw print on it and a few spikes..I cant seem to figure out how to add colors....
Err...yes I know it sucks, I'm still learning. Dont bother flaming! lol looks like a plate...more paw for you sir?
[IMG]http://i372.photobucket.com/albums/oo163/Seerofdeath_derp/st00f-2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i372.photobucket.com/albums/oo163/Seerofdeath_derp/st00f-1.jpg[/img]
If you flame, you have no life. Don't waste you life putting other people down. Unlike most People...i actualy tried.
Well: I added the colors..they could be beter. [IMG]http://i372.photobucket.com/albums/oo163/Seerofdeath_derp/st00f-3.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i372.photobucket.com/albums/oo163/Seerofdeath_derp/st00fbot.jpg[/img]

item.title: Err...maybe I should stick to coding. =[
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I like.
Nice job on the gem on the ring.
Shield has some nice shape.

Overall good job, i made a ring also, quick job.

Read full topic
item.source: Err...maybe I should stick to coding. =[

item.title: Err...maybe I should stick to coding. =[
item.dc:creator: @Seerofdeath Seerofdeath
item.description:
@Seerofdeath wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:2, topic:289527”]How to add colors : Mat/Material Panel.
Click on ‘New’ on your Material panel and choose a color, now in your Command block on your left you see ‘Mat’ click on that, now go on to your model, click on a face(click on your model ;)) and see what happens! It has now a new color added on it!

At the model : Don’t say that it sucks, this actually is quite creative.
I myself never saw something like this on this forum.
Don’t give up already
Practice a little bit more with Metasequoia and you will see that it will get easier.
I recommend you to read SilentCJ’s tutorial (Stickied on this section.) if you haven’t already read it.

Remember, Keep on modeling ;)[/quote]

I guess it’s ok for my first try ;0.
I’m not going to give up, I just didn’t think it was to good
and ty guys ima color it and update. ;)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 18, 2009, 01:28:08 pm[/size][hr]Just Finished my lame lightsaber lol…still using primitives

Well…it’s ok for a second try. I miss solidworks…lol 7th grade computer teacher had it. I was preaty good with that, i need to get the hang of this.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 18, 2009, 01:54:56 pm[/size][hr]Yet another model…getting beter, less use of primitives…ex:the bracets holding the ruby,the ruby.

Read full topic

item.title: Err...maybe I should stick to coding. =[
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

on the left side, on the panel i mean, click “mat” and then above that there should be “mat panel” or w.e when the mat tool is selected the face you put ur mouse over will glow yellow, this means when u click, it will colour that face to the colour selecting on the “mat panel” or w.e its called.

item.title: Err...maybe I should stick to coding. =[
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

How to add colors : Mat/Material Panel.
Click on ‘New’ on your Material panel and choose a color, now in your Command block on your left you see ‘Mat’ click on that, now go on to your model, click on a face(click on your model ;)) and see what happens! It has now a new color added on it!

At the model : Don’t say that it sucks, this actually is quite creative.
I myself never saw something like this on this forum.
Don’t give up already
Practice a little bit more with Metasequoia and you will see that it will get easier.
I recommend you to read SilentCJ’s tutorial (Stickied on this section.) if you haven’t already read it.

Remember, Keep on modeling
